help.jcr:content:
#Help - Main Menu
This help information is organized like the application main menu (left hand side of the page), and describes what each menu option does.

e07b38488ff99d4e.jcr:content:
#Edit
The edit menu contains features that are related to manipulating tree nodes. The most common used commands for creating new content or editing content are available directly on the main row as buttons labeled ADD, INS, EDIT, but other less common edit-related functions are found under the edit menu on the left.

_x0034_e871e4e9bdc699d.jcr:content:
#Rename
All nodes in meta64 are uniquely identifyable, by an internal tracking number that is like a database record number, but you can also give any node a more meaning full text name if you want. The main reason you would ever do this is so you can create a URL (permalink) that looks more user-friendly and readable than a long string of random-looking digits.
This menu item brings up a dialog that lets you name the currently selected node.

_x0032_ec98c4aa1d23e0a.jcr:content:
#Delete
You can permanently delete any node that you own. Do delete nodes, use the checkboxes to select which ones you want to delete and then click this delete menu item.

e083634c860a5845.jcr:content:
#Clear Selections
This menu item simply unchecks any and all checkboxes (node selections) you have made so you don't have to unclick them all one at a time if you don't want to.

_x0036_6320448820dcd44.jcr:content:
#Export
This is an admin-only function that exports the selected node content into an XML file that can then be re-imported back in. No downloading takes place. The export file is created right on the server file-system in the admin folder, that has been designated for this purpose.

_x0036_9725e4ba31d14ef.jcr:content:
#Import
Admin-only function that imports a file that was previously exported using the export function.

d2d1834eaa472864.jcr:content:
#Move
Move nodes to new locations on the tree.

_x0037_d3716499d6585f4.jcr:content:
#Cut
Cuts the selected nodes from their current location, pending your clicking on "Paste" to put them in a new location.

_x0034_fe51540bebf45a6.jcr:content:
#Paste
After you select some nodes and do a "Cut" use the "Paste" operation to put them under a different node. That is, the nodes will be moved to the new location on the tree underneath the node you have selected at the time you click "Paste"

d601c1408fbffdf9.jcr:content:
#Up
Moves the node up in the ordered list of children under its parent.

_x0038_982db438bd5e29a.jcr:content:
#Down
Moves the node down in the ordered list of children under its parent.

_x0030_dd8ca4abc339ffa.jcr:content:
#to Bottom
Makes the node become the first child under its parent.

fcf1d94e988dbad8.jcr:content:
#to Top
Makes the node become the last child under its parent.

dcb3fc4aa3047571.jcr:content:
#Attach
Each node is allowed to have one a file attachment. The Attachments menu is where you can add or delete these attachments. If you an attach an image it will show up inline in the document. Other types of files will not be displayed inline in the browser but users can click to download them.

a1686b4fb9b22caa.jcr:content:
#Upload from File
Allows you to upload files directly from your computer.

de0c814fbab219ed.jcr:content:
#Upload from URL
Allows you to upload a file using some existing internet URL (like the URL for an image, or PDF file, etc. anywhere on the internet that is publicly available)

d0d7dd48a451fb08.jcr:content:
#Delete Attachment
This will delete whatever file you have attached to the currently selected node.

_x0037_537564eb847d5cc.jcr:content:
#Share
Any node you own can be shared with specific other users of meta64, or else made public to everyone. Since sharing is by node, and subnodes, once you give someone (or the public) the ability to see a node they can see everything underneath it also.

d60a204c8354121b.jcr:content:
#Edit Node Sharing
Opens the node sharing dialog where you can add the names of other users that you want to have access to the given node. You can also make any node public, meaning all users can see it. By default when you create content in meta64 you are the only person who can see it, but if you share with other users then the other users can access the node using it's URL, and even start a conversation thread under the node or any if it's descendants.

d37a534eb7dc1f3d.jcr:content:
#Find Shared Subnodes
This feature will display all the nodes that you have shared with other users.

c9dcf2469eab8124.jcr:content:
#View
Allows you to configure how you want your pages to look, to you, during browsing meta64 content.

_x0037_f69f4499f3177cc.jcr:content:
#Toggle Properties
Each node in meta64 actually consists of a set of properties and values (key/values). Most users won't really need to see these properties presented directly, but if you toggle properties on, then you can see all the information (including some internal technical information) that the system stores for each node.

_x0032_a1da14eb8e2aeb3.jcr:content:
#Refresh
Meta64 is a SPA (Single Page Application) so you don't use your browser refresh to force a reload of the page, because that is the same as reloading the entire application. However, if you want to be sure your current page is displaying the latest information from the database, you can use this refresh to cause the app to refresh the data you are viewing.

ba96d446ae4e0695.jcr:content:
#Show URL
Each node is uniquely addressible online, and has it's own unique URL. Of course, only the owner of any given node and people that owner has shared the node with can actually view that URL, but nonetheless all nodes are able to be viewed directly if you know its URL. To see the external URL of a node, just click the node, and then choose "Show URL"

_x0039_33c6744a3f5a64d.jcr:content:
#Server Info
This is an admin-only feature that allows you to view certain technical server statistics such as how much memory is currently being consumes, and how many users have logged in, etc.

_x0032_8ce064886e2eabb.jcr:content:
#Search
The search menu allows you to find data in meta64. You can search for text, or you can view a 'timeline' for any node. The timeline is a dynamically generated (on demand generated) reverse-chronological view of any node. Timeline shows you all the subnodes under a given node, in the exact reverse order (newest on top) of the modification dates on all the nodes.

_x0032_86d8b48bb5de1bc.jcr:content:
#Content
To find text, under any portion of the tree, you can select a tree node and the click "Search->Content". This will let you enter the text to find and a search will be performed *only* underneath your selected node. So if you want to search *all* of your data you can just click "My Info" (Upper right of page), which takes you to your account root node, and then you can search from there.

b4ed9c4884e40106.jcr:content:
#Tags
Same type of feature as "Search->Content", except that only the property named "tags" on nodes will be searched, instead of searching the Content itself.

_x0035_7293340a128bc4d.jcr:content:
#Files
This is an experimental feature that performs searching of file-systems using the Apache Solr API. Displays the list of files found in a node that allows user to click on the file to open. The "Click to Open" currently assumes you are running as a private cloud and also assumes the server is running on your local machine where you would want to open the files.
This feature is essentially the equivalent of a "Desktop Search" similar to the original Google product called "Google Desktop Search" which was discontinued by Google.

_x0038_9884047a93a8f92.jcr:content:
#Created
The "Timeline" (of a Node) is defined as a simple flat list of all subnodes of the node ordered with the newest modification dates on top. That is, reverse chronological order. Once you are viewing the timeline listing you can also jump directly from any node in the timeline to the actual place on the tree (full tree context) where that node is located, with a single click.

_x0038_987054a966ef3b3.jcr:content:
#Modified
Performs the timeline function based on Modification time.

_x0038_f10054bba8fa5d8.jcr:content:
#Account
This menu allows you to manage your own meta64 account. Change password, email, close account, etc.

caf0cd4c96d22ed8.jcr:content:
#Change Password
Takes you to the change password dialog.

_x0032_ef5c848bebdbff4.jcr:content:
#Help/Docs
Help and Documentation about the meta64 platform.

_x0032_273334d83077ccc.jcr:content:
#Main Menu Help
Brings you to the content you are now reading.
